column5: Finally got the boat out of the garage to do some lake O fishing myself. Out yesterday off 50 Pt. I got into the Rainbows that you wouldn't believe, I lost count, 20 anyway and lost I don't know how many. Quite a few fish in the 10 to 12 LB. range Got there as soon as the park opened. Headed out to 90 FTW. I tried to set 2 riggers but it was almost imposable, for 2 hours the rods were going off big time. I was beat in that heat  , setting lines, netting fish,trying to set again. I only got a few pictures taking them myself is a chore. My poor camera got slimed all over. All fish were released except 2 I couldn't revive. Man what a day with that heat, I didn't want to get off the lake with fishing like that. Stayed out from 7 am to 3:30 pm. I only had a 1 hour dead time. I hope this weather doesn't screw up the fishing for Monday, taking a few guys out. I hope it won't be, You should have been here yesterday days
Hot diggity damn!  I was just looking at the long range forecast and it would seem Sunday is my best bet for getting my little tinny out there. *fingers crossed*
Nice to hear about those days!.. well done
Wow, Great report. Planning first trip out this year on Sunday, any advise on lure choices or colors? Any luck on Falshers & Flies? Thanks
WTG Dave! Really glad you had such a good day.
Very nice Dave!! Gotta love it when everything just lines up and the fishing is incredible! Thanks for the report.
Stellar indeed!  A great day for sure!
If you need a partner anytime (with a smoker) call me!!  I've yet to get my boat out of the driveway this year.

I just used spoons NK28 candy corn did the damage. I did take out the doctors and flies but never put them on. I like fishing light if possible. Spoons worked, that's what I stayed with.  Would like to but I have many buds that want to take them out. Some times I just like going by myself because I like Dark to Dark days. A lot call me crazy, but I just get so into it, I forget all about time.  Thanks guys. Get out there the fishing is fantastic right now.
Thanks for the info, How deep were you and how many FOW? Thanks
Awesome job on the lake!  I hope your next trip with your buddies is as good as this one.  Does this put you in a good enough mood to consider giving up those seats?  Hahaha!
That's awesome, what a wonderfuld day  Joey
I stayed in the 90 to 100 FTW, down 40' to 45' on the rigger, 30' back, speed 3.2 to 3.5 mph.   Disco, I have 4 of those seats, by next week I may need 4 more.
Very Nice! Looks like you had a blast.
way to farmer awesome day on the big o
Awesome report and pics Dave Can't complain of the heat on a productive day like that Thanks for sharing Leechman
